description: User groups at the Bedford Institute of Oceanography (BIO), which includes Fisheries and Oceans Canada, Environment and Climate Change Canada, Department of National Defense, National Resources Canada, and the Canadian Coast Guard, have a requirement for the rental of a fully operational Remotely Operated Vehicle (ROV) system consisting of: \\- an OceanusPro ROV (or equivalent) equipped with a single axis manipulator, \\- an ultra-short baseline acoustic positioning system (USBL, mountable and compatible with the ROV), \\- a forward looking SONAR system (mountable and compatible with the ROV), \\- and any associated equipment (i.e. tethers, umbilical, tag lines, etc.) required to perform the work described below. \\- One spare system (fully operational) of all required equipment is also needed due to the nature of the work -- in a remote location with a limited time window to complete the mission.\r\n\r\nAn experienced operator is also required to join the DFO/DRDC team during field operations in Barrow Strait, Nunavut. \\- The mission objective is to inspect and recover two underwater cables in Barrow Strait (Nunavut).

### Rental of Remotely Operated Vehicle (ROV) System and Operator 
#### Procurement Number: 30005713
#### Date of Publication: May 16, 2024
#### Tender Closing Date: May 31, 2024

A Request for Proposal (RFP) is issued by Pêches et Océans Canada (DFO) to obtain a fully operational Remotely Operated Vehicle (ROV) system for a critical underwater inspection and recovery operation in the Nunavut Territory.

The scope of work includes:

*	A fully operational ROV system consisting of:
	+	Main ROV unit (OceanusPro or equivalent)
	+	Remotely operated manipulator (single axis)
	+	Ultra-short baseline acoustic positioning system (USBL)
	+	Forward-looking Sonar system
	+	Tethered umbilical (with operational tag line)
*	 Spare ROV system for backup purposes
*	Experienced ROV operator to join the DFO/DRDC team during field operations for a minimum of 10 days

The primary objective of this mission is to safely inspect and recover two underwater cables in the remote region of Barrow Strait, Nunavut, within a limited timeframe.

Key Requirements:
*	ROV system to be compatible with local geography and environmental conditions
*	Spare ROV system and equipment to ensure mission continuity
*ший Experienced ROV operator to ensure safe and efficient field operations
*能力	Acoustic and Sonar systems to meet regulatory requirements

The proposal should be in English and French, and submitted electronically via the Entity procurement platform before the tender closing date mentioned above. The entity encourages interested bidders to download the details from the link below and contact [Louise Martel (louise.martel@dfo-mpo.gc.ca)](mailto:louise.martel@dfo-mpo.gc.ca) (819-962-7325)
